Job Title: Microsoft Security Architect

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Are you enthusiastic about Microsoft Security and want to play a key role in significantly strengthening our clients' overall security posture? Do you want to ignite your passion alongside a tribe of tech titans, where relentless learning fuels value-driven engineering and every day unleashes innovation's full force?  Keen to join Crayon US, where relentless learning fuels value-driven engineering and every day accelerating innovation?
Practical Information: Location: USA | Reports to: VP, Technical Services | Visa Requirements: Valid working visa for USA | Language Requirements: professional English, written and spoken | Work Arrangement: Remote 
Crayon is searching for a highly motivated Microsoft Security Architect to join our client consulting practice and report directly to the Director of Modern Work & Cloud. In this critical role, you will leverage your in-depth knowledge of Microsoft security solutions to design, implement, and manage security improvements for our clients. Working closely alongside clients, you will identify their security needs, translate them into technical solutions utilizing best-in-class Microsoft products, and ensure successful project delivery. 
Your Responsibilities: Conduct security assessments for clients, identify vulnerabilities and security gaps using industry frameworks and Microsoft security tools Collaborate with clients to develop customized security strategies aligned with their business needs and compliance requirements Design and implement secure architectures utilizing Microsoft security solutions like Microsoft 365 Defender suite, Microsoft Purview, Azure Security Services, Microsoft Entra for Identity and Access Management and Microsoft Copilot for Security Provide guidance and support during the implementation of security solutions, ensuring proper configuration of Microsoft security products Manage client security projects, ensuring successful delivery within budget and timeline
Your Competencies: 5+ years of experience in IT security with a strong focus on Microsoft security products and services. Strong understanding of networking and security fundamentals, cloud security concepts, Identity and Access Management (IAM), vulnerability management, attack surface management and security posture improvement A bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field would be preferred A relevant Microsoft security certification (e.g., SC-900, SC-500, Microsoft Security Architect Expert) would be a plus An inspiring security leader with a proven track record in enabling clients to significantly increase their security posture 
About You You have excellent communication and collaboration skills with the ability to explain complex security concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences You thrive in a dynamic environment, and your problem-solving skills shine when faced with complex challenges You bring a wealth of experience and a problem-solving and analytical mindset with a passion for staying current on the latest security threats and best practices
What’s on offer? Flex time PTO Employee Stock Option Program 401K Match (Vested from day 1) Maternity and Paternity Leave
Why Crayon US? At Crayon US, we believe people are what makes us great. We've been certified for the 2023 Great Place to Work and strive to foster an environment that includes a wide range of unique backgrounds and experiences.
Apply to join an award-winning employer!

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
